=== Conversion to and from other currencies ===
+
== Conversion to and from other currencies ==
Conversion to and from other currencies can be done in person at local exchangers, but is more commonly performed online through sites such as Bitomat, Britcoin, Mt. Gox and TradeHill exchange services.<ref>{{cite web|title=How to use bitcoin|url=http://bitcoinme.com/index.php/buy/|publisher=bitcoinme}}</ref> After two US Senators drew attention to Bitcoin for being the currency used in the [[Silk Road (anonymous marketplace)|Silk Road]] drug market place, [[Reuters]] wrote that "the Justice Department and other law enforcement agencies may be able to target" entities like Mt. Gox.<ref>Brett Wolf, (Jun 8, 2011) [http://www.reuters.com/article/2011/06/08/us-financial-bitcoins-idUSTRE7573T320110608 Senators seek crackdown on "Bitcoin" currency], Reuters</ref> Consequently Britcoin, the UK exchange, put out a statement calling for regulation of Bitcoin exchanges by law enforcement.<ref name="britcoin reuters" /><ref name="britcoin statement" />
Conversion to and from other currencies can be done in person at local exchangers, but is more commonly performed online through sites such as Bitomat, Britcoin, Mt. Gox and TradeHill exchange services.<ref>{{cite web|title=How to use bitcoin|url=http://bitcoinme.com/index.php/buy/|publisher=bitcoinme}}</ref> After two US Senators drew attention to Bitcoin for being the currency used in the [[Silk Road (anonymous marketplace)|Silk Road]] drug market place, [[Reuters]] wrote that "the Justice Department and other law enforcement agencies may be able to target" entities like Mt. Gox.<ref>Brett Wolf, (Jun 8, 2011) [http://www.reuters.com/article/2011/06/08/us-financial-bitcoins-idUSTRE7573T320110608 Senators seek crackdown on "Bitcoin" currency], Reuters</ref> Consequently Britcoin, the UK exchange, put out a statement calling for regulation of Bitcoin exchanges by law enforcement.<ref name="britcoin reuters" /><ref name="britcoin statement" />
â
====Bitomat====
+
===Bitomat===
[https://bitomat.pl/ Bitomat] is the Polish exchange. The site consistently trades within the top 5 spaces.<ref>[http://bitcoinwatch.com/ BitcoinWatch]</ref>
[https://bitomat.pl/ Bitomat] is the Polish exchange. The site consistently trades within the top 5 spaces.<ref>[http://bitcoinwatch.com/ BitcoinWatch]</ref>
â
====Britcoin exchange====
+
===Britcoin exchange===
[https://britcoin.co.uk/ Britcoin] launched March 2011 is the only exchange serving the UK<ref>[https://en.bitcoin.it/wiki/Trade#Currency_exchanges Bitcoin Wiki] - list of exchanges</ref>, based in the [[United Kingdom]]. Funds are deposited directly into their bank account. Britcoin is a project of the [http://bitcoinconsultancy.com/ Bitcoin Consultancy]<ref name="britcoin help">[https://britcoin.co.uk/?page=help Britcoin Help page]</ref> Britcoin engineers were responsible for uncovering an exploit in Mt. Gox before the price crash.<ref>[http://www.guardian.co.uk/technology/2011/jun/22/lulzsec-rogue-suspected-of-bitcoin-hack The Independent] - LulzSec rogue suspected of Bitcoin hack by James Ball</ref>
[https://britcoin.co.uk/ Britcoin] launched March 2011 is the only exchange serving the UK<ref>[https://en.bitcoin.it/wiki/Trade#Currency_exchanges Bitcoin Wiki] - list of exchanges</ref>, based in the [[United Kingdom]]. Funds are deposited directly into their bank account. Britcoin is a project of the [http://bitcoinconsultancy.com/ Bitcoin Consultancy]<ref name="britcoin help">[https://britcoin.co.uk/?page=help Britcoin Help page]</ref> Britcoin engineers were responsible for uncovering an exploit in Mt. Gox before the price crash.<ref>[http://www.guardian.co.uk/technology/2011/jun/22/lulzsec-rogue-suspected-of-bitcoin-hack The Independent] - LulzSec rogue suspected of Bitcoin hack by James Ball</ref>

The source code for the exchange is [[OpenSource]] under the [[AGPL]] license.<ref>[https://gitorious.org/intersango/ Gitorious] - Britcoin git repository</ref><ref name="britcoin help" />
The source code for the exchange is [[OpenSource]] under the [[AGPL]] license.<ref>[https://gitorious.org/intersango/ Gitorious] - Britcoin git repository</ref><ref name="britcoin help" />
â
====Mt. Gox Bitcoin Exchange====
+
===Mt. Gox Bitcoin Exchange===
As of June 2011, the Mt. Gox Bitcoin Exchange "handles the vast majority of Bitcoin trades."<ref>Brett Wolf, (Jun 15, 2011) [http://www.forexyard.com/en/news/Bitcoin-exchanges-offer-anti-money-laundering-aid-2011-06-15T220113Z Bitcoin exchanges offer anti- money-laundering aid]</ref> Tokyo-based K.K. Tibanne Co. runs the exchange under CEO Mark KarpelÃ¨s.<ref>[http://www.linkedin.com/profile/view?id=12664999 LinkedIn profile] of Mark KarpelÃ¨s</ref>
As of June 2011, the Mt. Gox Bitcoin Exchange "handles the vast majority of Bitcoin trades."<ref>Brett Wolf, (Jun 15, 2011) [http://www.forexyard.com/en/news/Bitcoin-exchanges-offer-anti-money-laundering-aid-2011-06-15T220113Z Bitcoin exchanges offer anti- money-laundering aid]</ref> Tokyo-based K.K. Tibanne Co. runs the exchange under CEO Mark KarpelÃ¨s.<ref>[http://www.linkedin.com/profile/view?id=12664999 LinkedIn profile] of Mark KarpelÃ¨s</ref>
The name "Mt. Gox" originally referred to [[Magic: The Gathering]] Online Exchange.<ref>Jack Hough, (Jun 10, 2011) [https://news.fidelity.com/news/news.jhtml?articleid=201106091257SMRTMONYNEWS_____31004&IMG=N&cat=Opinion&ccsource=rss-Opinion The Bitcoin Triples Again]</ref>
The name "Mt. Gox" originally referred to [[Magic: The Gathering]] Online Exchange.<ref>Jack Hough, (Jun 10, 2011) [https://news.fidelity.com/news/news.jhtml?articleid=201106091257SMRTMONYNEWS_____31004&IMG=N&cat=Opinion&ccsource=rss-Opinion The Bitcoin Triples Again]</ref>
â
====TradeHill Bitcoin Exchange====
+
===TradeHill Bitcoin Exchange===
Launched in June 2011, TradeHill Co. Ltd is a BitCoin exchange service based in [[Chile]] which provides a trading network for anyone to buy, sell, or exchange BitCoins.
Launched in June 2011, TradeHill Co. Ltd is a BitCoin exchange service based in [[Chile]] which provides a trading network for anyone to buy, sell, or exchange BitCoins.
